title: Oshima Peninsula
text:
The Oshima Peninsula (渡島 半島 "Oshima-hantō") is the <a href="south">south</a>ernmost part of <a href="Hokkaid%C5%8D">Hokkaidō</a>, the northernmost of the <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="island">island</a>s. Where the peninsula starts is open to interpretation. A more generous interpretation is to draw a line southeast from Ishikari Bay across the Ishikari Plain to <a href="Y%C5%ABfutsu%20District%2C%20Hokkaido">Yūfutsu District, Hokkaido</a>. A narrower interpretation is to draw a line connecting <a href="Suttsu%2C%20Hokkaid%C5%8D">Suttsu</a> on the <a href="Sea%20of%20Japan">Sea of Japan</a> and <a href="Oshamanbe%2C%20Hokkaid%C5%8D">Oshamambe</a> on <a href="Uchiura%20Bay">Uchiura Bay</a>. This narrow interpretation encompasses the <a href="Subprefectures%20in%20Hokkaid%C5%8D">subprefectures</a> of <a href="Oshima%20Subprefecture">Oshima</a> and <a href="Hiyama%20Subprefecture">Hiyama</a>.
At its southern end it forks into the southwest-pointing Matsumae Peninsula and the southeast-pointing Kameda Peninsula. These two peninsulas face <a href="Tsugaru%20Peninsula">Tsugaru</a> and <a href="Shimokita%20Peninsula">Shimokita Peninsula</a>s of <a href="Honsh%C5%AB">Honshū</a> across the <a href="Tsugaru%20Strait">Tsugaru Strait</a>. The <a href="%C5%8Cnuma%20Quasi-National%20Park">Ōnuma Quasi-National Park</a> is located on the peninsula.
The terrain of the peninsula is mountainous, with settlements mostly located in flat, lowland areas. Oshima Peninsula is home to several active <a href="volcano">volcano</a>es such as <a href="Mount%20E">Mount E</a> and <a href="Hokkaido%20Koma-ga-take">Hokkaido Koma-ga-take</a>. The area also contains several <a href="onsen">onsen</a> hot springs. The peninsula is home to two cities: <a href="Hakodate%2C%20Hokkaid%C5%8D">Hakodate</a> and the smaller adjacent <a href="Hokuto%2C%20Hokkaido">Hokuto</a>, as well as numerous small fishing and agricultural towns.
<a href="Matsumae%20Castle">Matsumae Castle</a>, the northernmost castle in Japan and only castle on the island of Hokkaido, is located on the Oshima peninsula.
The climate is <a href="humid%20continental%20climate">humid continental</a> ("Dfa"/"Dfb") except along the coast of the Matsumae Peninsula where it is <a href="oceanic%20climate">oceanic</a> ("Cfb",) The <a href="hardiness%20zone">hardiness zone</a> is high for an east-coast Northern Hemisphere location at such a latitude and ranges up to 8b on the Matsumae. <a href="https%3A//www.plantmaps.com/interactive-japan-plant-hardiness-zone-map-celsius.php"></a>
